entry.title: his white bear (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1253 Henry III of England ordered that his white bear (sculpture pictured) be permitted to swim and hunt in the River Thames?

entry.title: William Aitken (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that William Aitken, William J. Bain, J. Lister Holmes, John T. Jacobsen, and George W. Stoddard collaborated in the early 1940s to design America's first racially integrated public housing development?

entry.title: Plurality (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the prison scenes in the film Plurality were shot in an archaeology museum?

entry.title: 1990 Serbian constitutional referendum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 1990 Serbian constitutional referendum also took place at six voting stations in Montenegro for voters who were on holiday?

entry.title: Ana Sigüenza (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Ana Sigüenza was the first woman to be the general secretary of a national trade union center in Spain?

entry.title: Dollar Mountain Fire (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that during the 1929 Dollar Mountain Fire, 65 firefighters survived being surrounded by fire overnight by sheltering near a creek?

entry.title: Executioner's Tax (Swing of the Axe) (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the lyrics of "Executioner's Tax (Swing of the Axe)" were inspired by beheadings in medieval Europe?

entry.title: Bothell, Washington (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that up to 16,000 crows regularly commute from around the Seattle metropolitan area to a wetland in Bothell, Washington?

entry.title: a TikTok theory (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to a TikTok theory, burnt toast could save you from a car accident?
